profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-04-28 16:11:17 -0400.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Use of original papers requires an appointment and is limited to the Archives' Washington, D.C., Research Center. Microfilmed materials must be consulted on microfilm. Contact Reference Services for more information.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Addition: Unmicrofilmed; use requires an appointment.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 13 studio notebooks and travel journals; and drafts of unpublished manuscripts.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: REELS 1452-1453: Thirteen studio notebooks and travel journals, 1951-1973, containing numerous illustrations in watercolor, ink, and pencil, plus notes, observations, ideas for books and paintings, travel experiences, notes on art seen, etc. Onslow-Ford travelled to Japan, Hong Kong, Thailand, Tibet, India, Egypt, England, France, Spain, Central America, and Mexico.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: UNMICROFILMED: Drafts of two unpublished manuscripts: an early version of "Instant Painting," ca. 1960-1961, and "Creation," summer of 1971.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: ADDITION: Two draft calligraphic manuscripts for "Creation," ca. 1978, 44 oversize pages total.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: 35mm microfilm reels 1452-1453 available for use at Archives of American Art offices and through interlibrary loan.

originalsloc.head: Existence and Location of Originals
originalsloc.p: Reels 1452-1453: Originals returned to Gordon Onslow-Ford after microfilming.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Painter; Inverness, Calif.; b. Dec. 26, 1912, Wendover, England; d. Nov. 9, 2003

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Travel journals and notebooks lent for microfilming 1975. Manuscripts donated 1979 and 1992 by Gordon Onslow-Ford.
